conclusion: Consider principles of light and shadow to determine changes in shadows.
Light source is currently positioned in front of objects, casting shadows.
Shadows will change when light source moves to the back left or right.
Size and position of shadows are determined by relative positions of light source, objects, and observer.
Size of shadows will increase or decrease depending on distance between light source and objects.
Position of shadows will shift if light source moves.
Objects (clock, egg, domino) are currently positioned on the ground.
When light source moves, objects will move as well, but shadows will remain in same relative positions.
Shadow of clock (A) will change in size and position.
Shadow of egg (B) will change in size and position.
Shadow of domino (C) will change in size and position.
Shadow of box (D) will change in size and position.
Shadow of clock (A) will become larger and shift to the back left or right.
Shadow of egg (B) will become larger and shift to the back left or right.
Shadow of domino (C) will become larger and shift to the back left or right.
Shadow of box (D) will become larger and shift to the back left or right.
Shadows of all objects will change in size and position when light source moves to the back left or right.
